Bibliographic References: PP, no. 152, pis. 16 c and 19 d; PPSupp, no. 195; EAA i, p. 250, fig. 378; Pinsent, Gr. Myth., ill. on p. 57; D'AJessio, Dei e Miti, ill. on p. 129; Vian, Origines de Thibes, p. 46, no. 20, pi.
Imagery Description: (a) Cadmus and the dragon—below: Cadmus attacking the serpent, which is coiled by the spring, between two women; above: busts of Hermes, a woman with a mirror, Pan and a young satyr with thyrsus and wreath, [V) draped woman, holding egg in 1. hand, between halfNon Sepcifieddraped youth (Br) and PanNon Sepcifiedsatyr, holding egg and fillet.
